column4: Is there a way to `apt-get upgrade' only the security-related packages?
nah don't do it
can get the updates
I'm not following you. What do you mean "can get the updates?"
in update manager settings, can set to security updates only
Ahh....
what's broken about 9.10?
my mouse don't work, the screensaver brakes the x session
Ouch.
What sort of video card do you have?
Have you created an /etc/X11/xorg.conf, or are you just letting X configure itself?
I would try an `Xorg -configure' and let X tell you what it thinks it sees.
Also, pay attention to the mouse device. You might be needing to use the event device (/dev/event/mice), rather than psaux.
says X server already active
Yeah, you'll have to do it at the command line. Switch to a command prompt with ctrl-alt-f1, and then /etc/init.d/gdm stop.
This will kill your X session. It would help to have a nother computer nearby for Googling while you tweak your config...
YOu can test your modifications without starting gdm again by just doing `startx'.
nope still dont'work
that's correct.
I've installed an operating system on my two main workstations a combined 6 times in the past 3 weeks.
wow,
I keep all data on servers, so I can wipe any time.
i keep my backups on my server
